Authors:
Wendy Serra, María Bárbara Lugo Álvarez, Dariel García
Rodríguez, Eugenio Alonso-Oliva, Amalia Sanz Llorente, Vladimiro
Guarnaccia, Elma Carstens, Jeffrey A Rollins, Sofie Thijs, Jaco
Vangronsveld, Ana Margarita Manzano León
Title:
Polyphasic identification and MAT1-2 isolates of Phyllosticta
citricarpa in Cuba
Keywords: Citrus black spot; mating type; Polyphasic taxonomy
Abstract:
Citrus black spot (CBS), caused by Phyllosticta citricarpa
(McAlpine) van der Aa, is a disease that affects Citrus spp. causing
production losses, high costs associated with management, and
constraints on the fresh market trade. The present investigation aimed
to confirm the identity of the CBS pathogen as P. citricarpa and
determine its mating-type distribution in Cuba. Phyllosticta isolates
were collected from major Cuban citrus-producing provinces (Matanzas,
Cienfuegos, Camagüey and Santiago de Cuba). P. citricarpa and the
endophyte P. capitalensis (Henn.) were identified by polyphasic
taxonomy, integrating morpho-physiological characteristics with the
phylogenetic analysis of ITS, actA , LSU and tef1 loci. Mating-type (
MAT) analysis revealed that only the MAT1-2 idiomorph of P. citricarpa
is present in Cuba, providing evidence of an atypical CBS disease cycle.
These results contribute to a better understanding of the epidemiology
of CBS in Cuba and the improvement of CBS management.
